steps.text: Apply science to life.
Put on protective eyewear.
Wear appropriate gloves.
Use hearing protection.
Put on respirator.
Wear protective clothing.
Clean the new external composite surface with approved cleaner.
Remove all mold release materials.
Use 3M™ Perfect-It™ Boat Wash.
Use 3M™ Perfect-It™ High Performance Cloth.
Sand the old or new gelcoat using a DA sander with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron² II abrasive discs, grade 80+.
Apply dry guide coat to surface and re-sand for even texture.
Clean the repair area using approved cleaner or blow off with pressured air.
Use 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II Abrasive Discs, 3M™ Sander, 3M™ Hookit™ Soft Interface Pad, and 3M™ Dry Guide Coat for cleaning.
Mix 3M™ Marine Blister Repar Filler.
Apply filler to cavity, filling 85%.
Feather the repair after 30 minutes.
Apply a dry guide coat.
Re-sand.
Clean the area.
Mix 3M™ Marine Premium Filler and apply.
Sand with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II grade 120+ abrasive discs after filler has cured.
Use 3M™ Marine Blister Repair Filler, 3M™ Marine Premium Filler, and 3M™ Dry Guide Coat in the process.
Sand the repair area with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron² II grade 220+.
Prepare the sanding tools: 3M™ Sander and 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron² II Abrasive Discs.
Ensure surface is completely dry.
Mask areas with 3M Precision Masking Tape.
Back up masked areas with 3M Performance Industrial Masking Tape or Scotch Performance Masking Tape.
Mask the entire surface with 3M™ Purple Premium Plus Masking Film.
Apply 3M™ Tapes as needed.
Mix gelcoat in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 disposable spray cup.
Remove filter in the lid of the 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 disposable spray cup before mixing.
Adjust 3M™ Performance Spray Gun settings.
Hold spray gun 15cm-20cm from the surface.
Apply gelcoat.
Prepare the 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 Spray Cup System.
Attach the 3M™ Performance Spray Gun.
Install the 3M™ Performance Gravity HVLP Atomising Head.
Refer to gelcoat finishing process on page 3 and 4.
Clean the new external composite surface with approved cleaner.
Step 2: Unspecified action following cleaning.
Sand with 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II 320+ grade abrasive.
Sand with 400+ grade abrasive.
Use P800 grade 3M™ Hookit™ Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs if the surface is in good condition.
Refine P800 grade sand scratch using P1200 grade 3M Hookit Flexible Abrasive Foam Discs.
Use P1200 grade discs for sand refinement.
Compound the surface with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Heavy Cutting Compound.
Use a Rotary Polishing machine at 1400-1800 rpm with a 3M™ Perfect-It™ Low Linting Wool Compounding Pad.
Polish with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Compound + Polish.
Use a wool compounding pad at 1400-1800 rpm.
Apply 3M™ Perfect-It™ Boat Wax to a 10cm x 10cm area.
Wipe clean before it dries.
Clean.
Sand.
Scratch refine sanding.
Refine sanding.
Compound the surface with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Gelcoat Compound + Polish.
Use a Rotary Polishing machine at 1400-1800 rpm.
Follow 6-step process for protection.
Clean the surface with approved cleaner.
Apply step 2.
Use a DA sander with 3M Hookit 775L Cubitron II 80+ grade abrasive discs to sand the surface.
Clean the sanded surface.
Apply 3M™ Marine Premium Filler.
Apply dry guide coat.
Sand with 120+ grade.
Finish sanding with 220+ grade.
Clean the surface.
Ensure surface is dry.
Apply masking tapes and film.
Mix primer in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup.
Apply primer with a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun.
Maintain a distance of 15cm-20cm from the surface.
Apply dry guide coat.
Sand the primer with 320+ grade abrasive discs.
Repeat sanding with 400+ grade abrasive discs.
Clean the surface.
Mix paint in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup.
Apply paint with a 3M™ Performance Spray Gun.
Refer to the following page for the finishing process.
Clean the surface with approved cleaner.
Second step: unspecified.
Sand with 3M™ Hookit™ Purple Finishing Film Disc 260L+ P1200/1500 grade using a DA sander and soft interface pad (Dry method).
Sand with 3M™ Trizact™ Hookit™ Clear Coat Sanding Disc grade 1500 using a DA sander and soft interface pad, applying a light mist of water (Wet method).
Refine P1200 scratches with 3M Hookit Flexible Abrasive Foam Disc P2000 grade.
Apply dry refinement method.
Refine P1500 scratches with 3M™ Trizact™ Hookit™ Foam Abrasive Disc 443SA grade 3000.
Use a light mist of water.
Compound with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Fast Cut Plus Extreme.
Use a 3M™ wool or green foam compounding pad.
Use a rotary polisher.
Set the rotary polisher's speed to 1400-1800 rpm.
Polish the surface with 3M™ Perfect-It™ Ultrafina SE Polish.
Use a 3M™ wool or blue foam polishing pad.
Operate the polisher at 1400-1800 rpm.
Apply 3M™ Perfect-It™ Boat Wax to a 10cm x 10cm area.
Wipe clean before it dries.
Clean the surface with an approved cleaner.
Apply the cleaner to the surface.
Sand the bottom surface using a dual-action sander.
Use 3M™ Hookit™ 775L Cubitron™ II 220+ grade abrasive.
Clean the area.
Mix and apply 3M™ Marine Premium Filler.
Sand with 120+ grade abrasive after it cures.
Finish sanding with 220+ grade.
Ensure surface is dry.
Apply masking tapes and film.
Mix bottom paint in a 3M™ PPS™ Series 2.0 cup.
Hold 3M™ Performance Spray Gun 15cm-20cm from surface.
Apply paint using spray gun.
Conduct a workplace hazard assessment.
Follow all applicable regulations (e.g., OSHA, ANSI).
Products should not be used for consumer purposes without specific permission.
Comply with health and safety regulations when using products.
Consult a safety professional or visit www.3M.com.

constraints.text: Customer is responsible for product suitability.
Use appropriate safety equipment when handling industrial products.
